title: Tschichold's Penguin Compostion Rules
content: Can anyone please tell me where I can find Tschichold's Penguin Compostion Rules (set-out in the 1950's), web-based or in a specific book?
author: Double Elephant

comments.content: I'm really in need of them for my new project.

I know that the rules are in McLean’s [first book about Tschichold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416065147/http:/www.amazon.com/Jan-Tschichold-Typographer-Ruari-McLean/dp/0879238410/ref=sr_1_4/104-1774576-9253519?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1182109294&sr=1-4) as well as issue 49 of Baseline Magazine.

I too am looking for a set of these rules, just the rules, it's a 4 page document I believe, but the only refs I can find are to out of print or expensive books, and I'd like to supply a class of pupils with them.

I'm surprised there isn't a set to download from Penguin.

Any help would be much appreciated.

_...out of print or expensive books..._

Ruari McLean's book, [_Jan Tschichold: A Life in Typography_](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416065147/http:/www.amazon.co.uk/Jan-Tschichold-Typography-Introductions-20th-century/dp/0853316686/ref=sr_1_2/026-1069330-4820432?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1191957779&sr=1-2), is neither out of print nor expensive, since it's available in paperback.

You could also try a library.

3 years laters... I've found this link : "Penguin rules for the web", a re-write of Tschichold Penguin's typographic rules applied to the web : [http://www.beyondstandards.com/wp-content/uploads/2006/05/penguin\_rules\_...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416065147/http:/www.beyondstandards.com/wp-content/uploads/2006/05/penguin_rules_for_the_web.html "http://www.beyondstandards.com/wp-content/uploads/2006/05/penguin\_rules\_for\_the\_web.html")
3 years later? haha. wow. i'mma check it out
